message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the construction of perfect secrecy systems that are immune to spoofing attacks, which is a topic closely related to cryptography and security. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also relies on the existence of t-designs, which are objects studied in combinatorics and coding theory, suggesting that cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity) are also possible categories. The paper also mentions the use of cyclic difference families, which are objects studied in algebraic combinatorics, suggesting that cs.DS (Discrete Mathematics) is another possible category. Finally, the paper applies its results to an authentication model, which is a topic related to network security and protocols, suggesting that cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is a possible category as well.
